title: AI-Prompting for Dataset Analysis - Test
description: Test your understanding of using AI to write Python programs and interpret dataset results for tourism, vacations, or medical research.

questions.question: Which component is mandatory when prompting an AI to write Python code for dataset analysis?
options: Task
Tone
Persona
Exemplars

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the Context component?
options: To provide relevant details like dataset type, variables, and purpose of analysis
To specify the output format only
To define the AI's persona
To write the code itself
questions.answer: To provide relevant details like dataset type, variables, and purpose of analysis

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a Task for Python code generation?
options: Write a Python program to compute average stay per region and year from a tourism dataset
Comment on the results of the analysis
Summarize the Discussion section
Specify the tone of the report
questions.answer: Write a Python program to compute average stay per region and year from a tourism dataset

questions.question: What does the Exemplars component help the AI do?
options: Provide sample code or report structure to guide AI output
Decide the tone of writing
Choose the AI persona
Define the task
questions.answer: Provide sample code or report structure to guide AI output

questions.question: What is the recommended Format for the AI to generate Python code for analysis?
options: Clean, executable code with comments
Long paragraphs describing trends
Formal discussion text only
Bullet points without code

questions.question: How should the Tone be specified for scientific commentary?
options: Formal, precise, objective, and concise
Casual and humorous
Friendly and motivational
Informal and descriptive

questions.question: After generating Python code for dataset analysis, what is the next recommended step?
options: Use AI to write a report section interpreting the output, highlighting trends and anomalies
Run the Python code on a different dataset and compare results
Document the Python code only without discussing results
Write a general discussion section without referencing the analysis
questions.answer: Use AI to write a report section interpreting the output, highlighting trends and anomalies

questions.question: I want to analyze a CSV dataset of hotel bookings. Which prompt is most effective?
options: Write Python code to load the CSV, summarize key statistics, and visualize trends.
Write Python code to load the CSV and print the first 5 rows.
Write Python code to load the CSV, compute average stay per region and year, and generate plots for length_of_stay, region, and year columns.
Write Python code to describe the CSV structure.
questions.answer: Write Python code to load the CSV, compute average stay per region and year, and generate plots for length_of_stay, region, and year columns.

questions.question: You have a medical dataset with columns: patient_id, hospital, recovery_days, and treatment_type. Which prompt would best generate Python analysis?
options: Generate Python code to read the CSV and plot recovery trends.
Generate Python code to read the CSV, calculate mean recovery_days per hospital and treatment_type, and visualize the results.
Generate Python code to summarize all columns with general statistics.
Generate Python code to clean the CSV without further analysis.
questions.answer: Generate Python code to read the CSV, calculate mean recovery_days per hospital and treatment_type, and visualize the results.

questions.question: You want AI to write both code and a Results section from a tourism dataset with columns: city, year, visitors, and revenue. Which prompt is best?
options: Write Python code to compute average visitors per city and year, then write a Results section interpreting trends in visitors and revenue.
Write Python code to print the dataset, then write a Results section on visitor trends.
Write Python code to analyze revenue only, then write a Results section summarizing revenue.
Write Python code to load the CSV without any visualization, then write a Results section.
questions.answer: Write Python code to compute average visitors per city and year, then write a Results section interpreting trends in visitors and revenue.

questions.question: Which prompt is most precise for analyzing hotel booking data with columns: region, check_in_date, length_of_stay, and guest_age?
options: Write Python code to compute average length_of_stay by region and guest_age group and visualize the results.
Write Python code to summarize all columns with general statistics.
Write Python code to compute average length_of_stay by region only.
Write Python code to load CSV and print the first 10 rows.
questions.answer: Write Python code to compute average length_of_stay by region and guest_age group and visualize the results.

questions.question: You have a dataset of vaccinations with columns: country, year, vaccine_type, and coverage_rate. Which prompt will guide AI to produce the most useful analysis?
options: Write Python code to summarize the dataset and plot coverage_rate per country.
Write Python code to calculate average coverage_rate by country and vaccine_type, and generate plots showing trends over years.
Write Python code to load CSV and describe columns only.
Write Python code to filter vaccine_type and print the first 5 rows.
questions.answer: Write Python code to calculate average coverage_rate by country and vaccine_type, and generate plots showing trends over years.
